newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka says no rice imports until August.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka says no rice imports until August.

text.p: Sri Lanka will not import rice until August as the current crop has been satisfactory, an official of the agriculture ministry told Reuters on Monday.
The official, who declined to be identified, said imports will be delayed as the Maha crop, which runs over winter months, was expected to yield 1.5-1.6 million tonnes.
"It (the crop) will be enough for the next five months," the official said.
He said the exact crop figures will be available in the next two weeks after harvesting is over.
Sri Lanka last imported rice in late 1996 due to a shortfall caused by a severe drought and rising demand. The government also slashed duties to encourage imports by private traders.
Officials said last year that Sri Lanka needed to import more than 500,000 tonnes of rice to bridge the deficit.
Total import figures for 1996 were not immediately available.
Sri Lanka's annual rice demand is about 1.9 million tonnes.
